intro: Astragalus newberryi var. castoreus, commonly known as the Castoreus milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. It produces small, yellow to reddish pods that contain seeds dispersed by wind. Its botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystem.
